author: holgerd77
content: Hi, would it be possible to add the serialized BAL RLP to the test data from blockchain tests? That would be helpful to debug serialization issues! üôè

author: m0_ox
content: We could add this to blockchain test, but you can reference the `blockchain_engine` version of the same test as it is part of the engine requests. Does this help?

author: draganrakita
content: I was running v4.0.0 state tests and they fail a lot on transfer logs and selfdestruct logic üßµ

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Ahhhh nice! Yes I see now blockchain test has JSON format and engine has the access list as RLP.

Question regarding the engine API design, why is this part of the ExecutionPayload and not part of the extra params of request like e.g. `executionRequests`?
I'm confused here why BAL is part of ExecutionPayload and why executionRequests it /not/ part of ExecutionPayload

author: draganrakita
content: In v5.0.0 tests, transfer to itself produces the transfer log. This looks like a waste as no balance was transferred. Imo EIP needs clarification in this case, and would clarify it by adding if `address == target` do not create the transfer log.

author: jwasinger
content: I think it was decided to just emit a log rather than create a special edge case.

author: jwasinger
content: but I agree that the spec should not emit a log in this case.  we still have time to change it.

author: jochembrouwer
content:
This would match the case for `CALL`: 
> Any nonzero-value-transferring CALL to a different account, at the time that the value transfer executes
The tx one now has an edge case and is treated different than CALL, as tx thus emits a log also if target is self.

author: jochembrouwer
content: I find the `SELFDESTRUCT` section slightly ambiguous, dus this only mean selfdestruct in the sense of https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-6780 (so not in case of `SENDALL` ?)

author: m0_ox
content: Yeah this does not feel so clear. Related conversation [here](https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/688075293562503241/1465722727481475174)
